p: The antioxidant activity of P. bullata callus was also expressed as ascorbic acid equivalent. This method was used to express the antioxidant activity for direct comparison with the well-known potent antioxidant that is widely distributed in plant materials [ 62]. The higher the ascorbic acid equivalent value, the higher the antioxidant activity [ 60]. The study by Tadhani et al. [ 63] found that the callus of Stevia rebaudiana exhibited a higher ascorbic acid equivalent with 32.32 ± 0.56 mg AEAC/g. The ascorbic acid equivalents from Salvia tebesana callus that were derived from different explants showed a variation of antioxidant activity ranging from 14.1 ± 0.32 to 36.2 ± 0.35 mg AEAC/100 g extract [ 64].
